Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.Server
public class Server extends Object
Main server class that starts a socket server. It can handle different types of connections.

  • Method Details

    • initController

      public GameController initController(Message receivedMessage)
      Method used to implement the correct GameController. It's a factory method, returns a GameController.
      Parameters:
      receivedMessage - message passed to the factory.
      Returns:
      GameController.

    • addClient

      public void addClient(String nickname, ClientHandler clientHandler) throws TryAgainException
      Adds a client to be managed by the server instance.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname associated with the client.
      clientHandler - the ClientHandler associated with the client.
      Throws:
      TryAgainException - if the client's nickname has already been chosen.

    • removeClient

      public void removeClient(String nickname)
      Removes a client given his nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the VirtualView to be removed.

    • createNewGameController

      public void createNewGameController(Message message) throws WrongMessageSentException
      This method creates a new GameController associated to the gameNumber. Then the method gets from the message the number of players and calls GameController.prepareGame(playerNum) to create a new game with the number of players declared in the message.
      Parameters:
      message - message with the number of players.
      Throws:
      WrongMessageSentException - if the gameNumber is already in the list.

    • getMessage

      public void getMessage(Message message)
      This method is divided in three parts: 1) If the server receives a CreateGameMessage then a new GameController. is created and the creator automatically join the game. 2) If the server receives a JoinGameMessage then the client is added to the chosen existing game. 3) Else the message is passed to the correct gameController.
      Parameters:
      message - message that will be controlled as said before.

    • getGameControllerMap

      public Map<Integer,GameController> getGameControllerMap()
      Returns the actual gameControllerMap.
      Returns:
      the actual gameControllerMap.

    • getClientHandlerMap

      public Map<String,ClientHandler> getClientHandlerMap()
      Returns the actual clientHandlerMap.
      Returns:
      the actual clientHandlerMap.

    • onDisconnect

      public void onDisconnect(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      This method handles what happens when a client disconnect from the server. The method must eliminate the GameController from the gameControllerMap. then removes the nickname and the clientHandler.
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - the ClientHandler that has disconnected.

    • onQuit

      public void onQuit(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Handles the end of a game at server-side. This means that the client of the player must be removed from the server, and that the game controller associated to the terminated game must be removed if all the players have eventually been safely removed.
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - the ClientHandler that has ended a game.
